Abraham Lincoln to Zachary Taylor, 15 March 18501 I understand some one of ourOhiofriends will probably be appointed Minister toBrazil; and if so, I hope Hon:Robert C. Schenckmay be the man– In expressing a preference for MrSchenck over others of his ownState, I do not mean to say he is less worthy than any out of his state; but were I to
               not limit myself as I do, I should probably come in collision with some recommendation
               of my own, formerly made; or, perhaps with the interests of some friend of my ownstate–2

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed this letter.
